This thread is for the discussion of scale plastic (and resin, PE, wood, etc) models kit
-Post photos of your builds in progress and your finished builds
-Have your builds critiqued or critique others
-Discuss tips and techniques
-Ask for advice or give advice to others

>No manufacturer is purely perfect or awful. ALWAYS research your kits before buying.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com: I'm aiming to repaint pic related so she's blonde. First time I'm attempting something like this so I'd appreciate any advice. I'm especially afraid I'll flatten all the detail in the hair. Is hitting it with primer a given?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10167493
Primer isn't necessary. Use high quality paints, thin them, paint in several fine coats letting them dry before the next, start with a darker base, and a drybrush with a lighter color to allow the darker color to rest in the hair's sculpted grooves. Check other blonde hair on figs for reference. And most imoportantly, practice on crap figs you don't care about first.

threads.name: Morphine-Kun
threads.com:
Welcome back everyone, hope you're all doing well.

The time has come for us to finally have new releases in the line! By now most of everyone who ordered Olivier and Vania should have them in hand. Its seems the delay was worth it as Olivier seems to be one of the better releases in the line. Vania also seems to be a generally good release as people are having fun messing with her and Olivier. As of now, we only have one other figure up for Pre-Order right now, that being Bikini Clover. Currently we know that the Polynian and Touhou series will continue since Marisa is supposedly the next in line to go up. The official Poly 4Koma is still going and it seems its been well received as it gives little look into the everyday lives of the Polys we know. We also had a wonderful surprise in the form of the new Polynian MLL body! We finally have a counterpart to the Iana body. Aside from that things have been pretty quiet for the time being.

As always, here is the assistance e-mail for those who need it, so if any problem should arise, feel free to contact them over at "user_support@mile-stone.jp" or the shop you purchased the figure from.

Once again, feel free to share your photos and adventures, they add life and some fun to the thread. Also, welcome newcomers, we hope you enjoy your stay.

He's based on fakirs and aghoras in India who'd do magic tricks like stretching limbs, climbing up a rope and disappear, charm animals etc etc. Basically modern tricks sword swallowing, levitation, disappearing and re appearing elsewhere and loads of other tricks were all Indian in origin. The skull necklace is based in Aghoris who are basically Hindu shaman.
>Aghori rituals, which are performed precisely to oppose notions of purity commonplace in orthodox Hinduism, are typically macabre in nature. The Practices of Aghoris vary and include living in cemeteries, smearing cremation ashes on their bodies, using human skulls for decoration and bowls, smoking marijuana, drinking alcohol, and meditating on top of corpses. Although contrary to mainstream Hinduism, these practices exemplify the Aghori philosophy of criticizing commonplace social relations and fears through the use of culturally offensive acts. Furthermore, they demonstrate the Aghoris’ acceptance of death as a necessary and natural part of the human experience. The Aghori tradition is basically categorized under the shamanic marg of sadhana.

I usually clean my shelves and toys with brushes and towels and i'm thinking in get a handheld vacuum to clean more fast.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com: cheap makekup brushes. they work wonders and are really gentle

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10163174
I use a damp cloth for the shelves and a can of compressed air on the figures themselves. If the figure is really bad I have small brushes I use to get I to nooks and crannies. It works.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10163174
Large makeup brush from the dollar store

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10163174
I remove the accessories and suck on them while playing videogames, that way I can control the cleanse by feeling around the figure with my tongue. I usually suck limb by limb, but sine I'm holding the controller with both hands, have to put my lips over my teeth to hold down the limb, while swirling my tongue. It helps avoid bite marks. I highly recommend this method, just be careful with the small accessories, because you may swallow them by accident, then you have to wait until expulsion to be able to clean them, and the taste can be discomforting.

I've found this is the best way to clean toys.

threads.name: Santa Man
threads.com:
It's November 1st, so you know what that means. It's time for /toy/ Secret Santa 2022!

There doesn't appear to be as many shipping delays this year but I'm still making the cut off for sign up November 6th like last year because it worked out well and gives everyone through the weekend to sign up. I will try to have assignments out by the 7th or the 8th at the latest.

There are some small changes to SS this year though:
>The budget has been changed from 25-35 usd to 30-40 usd
>Proof of purchase will now require you to send me a picture of your gift with a timestamp before I give it the ok along with the receipt
>I will not be pairing up Canadians domestically due to issues in the past. Those who wish to ship domestic will be paired with people in the US. Sorry for the inconvenience.

For more info on these changes check the FAQ as I've detailed it there for the exception of the price change because the explanation for that is very simple. I picked out the original 25-35 price range several years ago and after years of running the event I felt bumping the price up by 5 dollars better reflects what people actually spend on the event, that's all.

My email: toysecretsanta2022@gmail.com
Sign-up form: https://forms.gle/yXbEEiFmu8t1xTs77
FAQ: https://pastebin.com/jA4SUZUQ

>plushies are easier to reproduce
>cloth-caped action figure aren't common because otherwise its price goes up
i dont understand

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10161143
Different type of cloth and you need separate part of company which will produce capes other fabrics for pure plastic toys.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>10161143
-Lots more labor involved when working with cloth capes than just popping a plastic cape out of the mold. The fabric has to be cut, sewn, attached, results in longer time for QC checks as well
-Additional material needed aside from the various other plastics used for the figure
-Usually has to be sourced from a different supplier than the one supplying the plastics, introducing additional logistical headaches
-Additional safety testing needed since fabrics have standards they have to meet (fire retardation, stretch/tear resistance, dyes). Also has to be checked for loose metals (needles or pins) in the fabric by passing through xrays before leaving the factory.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.sub: Toy Price Reticence is an Illusion
threads.com: Do you think toy prices are going too high? I don't think it will get better, no matter what you have heard about companies noticing consumer "price sensitivity" in news articles and such. Because companies see prices on ebay, they see nostalgia out there, and they know there will always be rich suckers. It may go out of your price range, but it will always be within the price range of some rich trust fund baby who grew up on whatever IP they have and must collect everything from it. Don't expect toy prices to come down just because they are no longer within reach of the average Joe. Instead they will just inflate to be only for "collectors," but not "collectors" as it is known today; rather "collectors" as in rich single childless male making over 150k a year from his senior systems architect job.

last_replies.com:
Domestics, absolutely. the price to value ratio is awful, worse than it's ever been. I can only see it getting worse, especially with how the two leaders, McFarlane and Hasbro, both have horrible cost cutting issues. Hasbro's lines are seeing a severe reduction in QC and paint, and McFarlane has and continues to have the same amount of problems with paint and accessories.
Imports aren't really doing much better, but their prices got hiked 6 or so years ago and continue to go up, so seeing a Chogokin or something from Sentinel at 300% what it was in 2010 just feels like the logical conclusion and not the shock of the last 3 years of domestic price hikes and quality drops.
